name: The Fiddler and His Friends Quiz | Musicals | 15 Questions

questions.text: This character constantly seeks money, but he doesn't have a steady job. Who is he?
questions.explanation:
Nahum.

	Reb Nahum is the village beggar who asks Lazar Wolf for some money during the song "Tradition".

questions.text: Which character's son is paired up with a girl who is nearly blind?
questions.explanation:
Avram.

	Avram's son, who isn't much to look at, is paired with Ruchel, who's nearly blind. As Yente the matchmaker says: "The way he looks and the way she sees, it's a perfect match!"

questions.text: Who is the main character of the show?
questions.explanation:
Tevye.

	Tevye's easygoing nature and faith in God and in tradition lets him be largely at peace with the world.

questions.text: This timid tailor wants to marry the milkman's eldest daughter. Who is he?
questions.explanation:
Motel.

	Motel Kamzoil and Tzeitel gave each other their pledge that they would marry over a year before Motel mustered up enough courage to ask Tevye for his daughter's hand in marriage.

questions.text: This rich butcher also wants to marry the milkman's eldest daughter! What is his name?
questions.explanation:
Lazar Wolf.

	At first it looks like Lazar Wolf will marry Tzeitel, but Tevye changes his mind and lets Motel marry her.

questions.text: This young girl falls in love with a student from Kiev. Who is she?
questions.explanation:
Hodel.

	Hodel and Perchik, the student, start off debating life in Anatevka. Their constant bickering soon turns to love, and Perchik proposes at the start of Act Two.

questions.text: This Ukranian elopes with one of the milkman's daughters. Who is he?
questions.explanation:
Fyedka.

	Fyedka is an outcast in the village because he is not Jewish, but he and Chava begin a romantic relationship anyway.

questions.text: This character runs the inn in Anatevka. Who is he?
questions.explanation:
Mordcha.

	Mordcha charges a fee so he can participate in weddings. His inn serves as a watering hole for all of Anatevka.

questions.text: This person is the religious leader of Anatevka.
questions.explanation:
The Rabbi.

	The Rabbi is the religious leader of the majority of people in Anatevka, although there is also a priest. The Rabbi can think up blessings for almost anything, including sewing machines and tsars!

questions.text: This character is the Rabbi's son.
questions.explanation:
Mendel.

	Hodel at first has her eye set on Mendel, but she eventually marries Perchik. Mendel has lines in the song "Anatevka".

questions.text: This character gives lessons for food.
questions.explanation:
Perchik.

	Perchik is a student from Kiev who challenges the traditional ways of Anatevka. He is eventually imprisoned in Siberia for his radical ideas.

questions.text: This character is the deceased wife of the butcher. Who is she?
questions.explanation:
Fruma Sarah.

	Fruma Sarah was a jealous, greedy woman who cared most about her pearls. Tevye fabricates a dream in which Fruma Sarah convinces him not to let Lazar Wolf marry Tzeitel.

questions.text: This character is responsible for making matches in Anatevka. Who is she?
questions.explanation:
Yente.

	Yente, the matchmaker, is entrusted with making couples out of Anatevka's young adults. She sees her profession diminish in importance when Motel and Tzeitel decide to wed without a matchmaker, and when Perchik and Hodel do the same.

questions.text: This strong-willed woman is the wife of the milkman. Who is she?
questions.explanation:
Golde.

	Golde keeps the family together and the house clean as Tevye works. Her iron will makes her more than a match for Tevye's temper.

questions.text: This young woman elopes with a young Ukranian. Who is she?
questions.explanation:
Chava.

	Chava goes against the wishes of her family and elopes with Fyedka. As a result, Tevye disowns her, claiming she is dead to him.
